name: Modified Mithdradates Blood And Faith (Bard 3 / Cleric 27 / RDD 10)
author: Orion

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Mithdradates posted his Blood And Faith build here in the ECB Archives in 2006.

It has a full undispellable cleric spellbook, full tumble/spellcraft, UMD, BAB 25 to get two full BAB attacks/round with extended divine power and a warrior's base AB of 42 (which when combined with cleric buffs allows for astronomically high values).

I noted a few comments in the thread, notably 
- Kail Pendragon suggesting a Bard 2 Cleric 10 RDD 8 split pre-epic for faster RDD goodies at the expense of 1 AB, it also improves saves slightly by taking levels in all these classes pre-epic.
- jjjhhhlll suggesting a Cleric 28 / Bard 2 / RDD 10 split for slightly higher caster levels, which Mithdradates suggested maybe a Cleric 27 / Bard 3 / RDD 10 split might be a reasonable middle ground.

I included Mith's middle ground suggestion, and I modified Kail's suggestion to a Bard 2 Cleric 8 RDD 10 split pre-epic for even faster RDD goodness. 

28 Str (40 Str capped) at level 15, yes please! :)

I investigated Kail's idea to take Bard at level 1 for extra skill points, but this would mean starting Charisma would have to be 11 so I did not incorporate this.

I also dropped Int down to 12, final Wisdom down to 19 and increased the ending strength to 38. 

With this high strength which could be capped at 50, I took a two handed weapon. 

A single handed weapon would provide more staying power and allow the cleric to take full advantage of up to +8 AC from Magic Vestment + tower shield.

I would have liked to max Discipline as well but wasn't sure what to drop to get it. I thought this could be worked around with knockdown immune items. 

In a module with enemies which will frequently disarm you I would probably take the points from spellcraft into discipline and do a Bard 4 / Cleric 26 / RDD 10 split for an extra skill dump.

A Dev Crit version of this build can be made by dropping four great strengths (final Str 34) and improved knockdown. 

I wasn't sure if Dev Crit would necessarily make this build stronger. 

Bosses tend to be extremely resistant to this ability anyway (one has to crit, then usually make the boss roll a 1, and a smart designer will either make bosses crit immune or have sky high AC and/or sky high fortitude saves). 

I'm quite happy just hitting them with 50 strength buffed by all the cleric goodies such as divine favor, darkfire etc and a two handed weapon with two full BAB attacks / round from divine power anyway. 

Anyway I've probably made enough mods to Mith's build to make it my own but for the time being I will call it Modded Mith B&F for now whilst I get some suggestions from the magnificient ECB'ers and until I develop some sort of lore / character background for this, there's got to be a cool story behind this dragon cleric.

posts.author: Cornflower
posts.content: Err... I should probably be able to figure this out myself, but... This build has three attacks per round, yes?

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
BAB 26+ at level 40 = 4 attacks per round (or 6 attacks per round, if Monk UBAB)
BAB 23-25 at level 40 = 3 attacks per round (or 5 attacks per round, Monk UBAB)
BAB 21-22 at level 40 = 3 attacks per round (or 4 attacks per round, Monk UBAB)
BAB 20 at level 40 = 2 attacks per round (or 4 attacks per round, Monk UBAB)

Feel free to copy and paste this somewhere for reference :)

So yes 3 attacks per round
But that is intentional design for maximal efficiency for clerics.
Divine power, when cast, will give the cleric an equivalent fighter's BAB and attack schedule.
The caveat being the Divine Power extra attack is at Full BAB. 

Ie 42/37/32 -> 48/43/38 / 48 when divine power is cast.

Overall if cleric buffs are undispellable it probably is stronger to have a cleric who relies on divine power to get that additional full BAB attack

Max's guide to clerics in the ECB forum goes into more detail
